item.title: Analyzing Marathon Data
item.description: I was curious if I could improve my chances of running a good race using historical race data

item.title: Modeling the Economics of Residential Solar
item.description: I’ve enjoyed trying new technologies for as long as I can remember. In this post, I explore if installing solar panels on my home is worth it.

item.title: Reading Audiobooks
item.description: Unpacking the unspoken etiquette when saying you read an audiobook.

item.title: Beyond Automated Feature Engineering to Feature Stores
item.description: While automating human intelligence is exciting, the core challenge is providing machine learning-ready data for developers who don’t want to do feature engineering.

item.title: Running in the wrong direction
item.description: The last 7 years all kicked off because my curiosity lead me in the direction of a new technology and great group of people to work with. Now, it’s time to do that again by starting to running again, even if it might be in the wrong direction.

item.title: Leaving Alteryx
item.description: After 2 years, last month marked the end of my time at Alteryx.

item.title: You cannot do data science without open source
item.description: While I had a strong feeling back in 2017 when I made my first open source library, it’s even more clear today that you cannot do data science without open source.

item.title: Bookshelf
item.description: Here are some of the books I’ve read or have sitting on my bookshelf to read one day. I’ve stared the books I particularly enjoyed. Do you have recommendations me? Let me know. How We Got to Now by Steven John Lying by Sam Harris Outliers by Malcom Gladwell The Merchant of Power by John F. Wasik The Art of War by Sun Tzu High Output Management by Andy Grove Kite Runner by Khaled Hosseini ★ Skunk Works: A Personal Memoir by Ben Riche ★ Atomic Habits by James Clear ★ Surely You're Joking, Mr.

item.title: Papers
item.description: Here’s a selection of papers I have authored or co-authored Using Long-Duration Storage to Reduce Portfolio Carbon Emissions Risk exec summary | full paper The Machine Learning Bazaar: Harnessing the ML Ecosystem for Effective System Development pdf Deep Feature Synthesis: Towards Automating Data Science Endeavors pdf Prediction Factory: automated development and collaborative evaluation of predictive models pdf Label, Segment, Featurize: a cross domain framework for prediction engineering pdf CommunityFinder: Software to Analyze Communities that Develop in MOOC Discussion Forums pdf Activity Classification using Smartphone Accelerometer Data pdf ColorCrack: Identifying Cracks in Glass pdf OK: OAuth 2.

item.title: Projects
item.description: GridStatus.io The electric grid is a remarkable feat of engineering that is easy to take for granted. However, as we decarbonize and electrify society, knowing when, where, and how our electricity is generated will be more important than ever. I built Grid Status to provide access to the historical, real-time, and forecasted data to accelerate researching and building applications for our energy grid. GridStatus.io ➜ GitHub ➜ Heat Pumps Work
